alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Curry County; De Baca County; Eastern San Miguel County; Guadalupe County; Harding County; Quay County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:59PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN ROOSEVELT, EAST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL, EASTERN DE BACA, SOUTHEASTERN HARDING, NORTH CENTRAL CHAVES, QUAY, CENTRAL CURRY AND EAST CENTRAL GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM MDT... At 359 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles west of Ute Lake State Park to 6 miles south of Sumner Lake. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Quay, Tucumcari, Logan, Fort Sumner, Melrose, San Jon, Grady, House, Saint Vrain and Ragland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 310 and 370. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 309 and 376. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 92 and 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for northeastern and east central New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Curry County; De Baca County; Eastern San Miguel County; Guadalupe County; Harding County; Quay County; Roosevelt County
